{{use dmy dates|date=May 2015}} {{Infobox newspaper | name = Semanário Económico | logo = | image = | caption = | type = Weekly business newspaper | format = | owners = | founder = | publisher = Ongoing Media | editor = | chiefeditor = | assoceditor = | maneditor = | newseditor = | managingeditordesign = | campuseditor = | campuschief = | opeditor = | sportseditor = | photoeditor = | staff = | foundation = 16 January 1987 | political = | language = [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] | ceased publication = August 2009 | headquarters = [[Lisbon]] | circulation = | sister newspapers = ''[[Diário Económico]]'' | ISSN = | oclc = | website = }} '''''Semanário Económico''''' was a weekly [[Business journalism|business newspaper]] published in [[Lisbon]], [[Portugal]], from 1987 to 2009.
==History and profile== ''Semanário Económico'' was first published on 16 January 1987.<ref>{{cite web|title=Overview of the Sector|url=http://www.gmcs.pt/en/overview-of-the-sector-20140314-164712|work=GMCS|accessdate=17 May 2015|date=19 May 2014}}</ref> It had its headquarters in Lisbon.<ref>{{cite web|title=List of Portuguese Media|url=http://portuguese-embassy.co.uk/en/press-and-information/list-of-portuguese-media.html|work=Embassy of Portugal in the United Kingdom|accessdate=17 May 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150202205505/http://portuguese-embassy.co.uk/en/press-and-information/list-of-portuguese-media.html|archivedate=2 February 2015|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The paper was owned by Ongoing media,<ref>{{cite news|title=The Portuguese group Ongoing uses Protecmedia to launch a new financial newspaper in Brazil|url=http://www.protecmedia.com/eng/modelo-detalle-de-noticias-eng/noticias/42125/the-portuguese-group-ongoing-uses-protecmedia-to#.VVh5sFXtmko|accessdate=17 May 2015|work=Protec Media|date=2009}}</ref> which bought it from the holding Económica.<ref>{{cite web|author1=Fernando Correia|author2=Carla Martins|title=Media Landscapes. Portugal|url=http://ejc.net/media_landscapes/portugal|work=European Journalism Centre|accessdate=17 May 2015}}</ref> In the mid-2000s the paper was part of Media Capital.<ref>{{cite book|author=Gustavo Cardoso|title=The Media in the Network Society: Browsing, News, Filters and Citizenship|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=PRH7Ay7NOKQC&pg=PA272|accessdate=17 May 2015|year=2006|publisher=Lulu.com|isbn=978-1-84753-792-8|page=272}}</ref>
''Semanário Económico'' was mostly read in [[Greater Lisbon]] and [[Centre of Portugal]].<ref name=pub/> In 2007 the paper had a circulation of 9,000 copies.<ref>{{cite web|author=Anne Austin et. al.|title=Western Europe Market and Media Fact|url=http://conan.lib.muohio.edu/ebooks/Western_Europe_Market_MediaFact_2008/Western%20Europe%20Market%20&%20MediaFact%202008.pdf|work=Zenith Optimedia|accessdate=17 May 2015|date=2008}}</ref> In 2008 the paper sold 9,954 copies.<ref name=pub/> In August 2009 the paper was renamed as ''[[Weekend Económico]]''.<ref name=pub>{{cite web|title=Semanario Economico becomes Weekend Economico|url=http://www.publicitas.com/spain/media-news-events/news-detail/?newsid=31033&title=portugal-semanario-economico-becomes-weekend-economico#.VHyeRGSsXRB|work=Publicitas|accessdate=17 May 2015|date=3 August 2009}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}

{{Other people|Sergey Aslanyan}} {{Infobox person | name = Sergey Aslanyan | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Sergey Gareginovich Aslanyan | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1973|09|18}} | birth_place = [[Yerevan]], [[Soviet Union]] | death_date = | death_place = | residence = [[Moscow]], [[Russia]] | nationality = Russian | other_names = | known_for = | occupation = Chairman, [[MaximaTelecom]] | alma_mater = {{Moscow University|1996}} | networth = }}
'''Sergey Aslanyan''' ({{lang-ru|link=no|Сергей Гарегинович Асланян}}; born September 18, 1973, [[Yerevan]], [[Soviet Union|USSR]]) is a [[Russia]]n businessman and [[Senior management|executive manager]]. He is the founder and Chairman of the Board at [[MaximaTelecom]].
== Biography == Sergey Aslanyan was born in [[Yerevan]], Armenia, graduated from [[MSU Faculty of Computational Mathematics and Cybernetics|Faculty of Computational Mathematics and Cybernetics]] at [[Moscow State University|Lomonosov Moscow State University]]. In 1996 Aslanyan he received a degree in Applied Mathematics.
Aslanyan started his career in 1997 as a senior consultant at the auditing company [[Coopers & Lybrand]], which soon merged with Price Waterhouse and was titled [[PricewaterhouseCoopers]]. In 2001, he joined [[TNK-BP|TNK-BP Management]] in the position of deputy head of the information technology unit.
In December 2003, Aslanyan was invited to join [[MTS (network provider)|Mobile TeleSystems]] as Vice President of Information Technology – this position was created specially for him.<ref name=mts-sostav>{{cite web |url = http://www.sostav.ru/news/2003/12/22/2/ |title = Бывший замруководителя блока информационных технологий ТНК-ВР Сергей Асланян назначен вице-президентом по IT компании МТС |date = 2003-12-22 |publisher = Sostav.ru |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref><ref name=mts-vz>{{cite web |url = http://www.vz.ru/news/2007/10/3/114314.html |title = Сергей Асланян возглавил ОАО "Ситроникс" |date = 2007-10-03 |publisher = [[Vzglyad (newspaper)|Vzglyad newspaper]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-04-16 }}</ref> In July 2006 he was appointed as Vice President of Engineering and Information Technology. He supervised the transition of the telecommunications operator to a new [[Telecommunications billing|billing system]], the implementation of [[Oracle Corporation|Oracle]] [[Enterprise resource planning|ERP]] system and [[Document automation|workflow automation system]], and he was responsible for the integration of companies acquired by MTS network.<ref name=bio-sf>{{cite journal | author = Константин Бочарский | title = Нам нужно пять кварталов, чтобы стать прибыльными | url = http://secretmag.ru/archive/sec-firm_15_210408.pdf | publisher = Secretmag.ru Magazine | date = April 2008 | volume = 15 (247) | issn = 1727-4176 }}</ref>
In October 2007 Aslanyan became president of the [[Sitronics]] group, which belonged to investment holding [[Sistema|JSFC Sistema]] just as Mobile TeleSystems.<ref name=utkin-rbc>{{cite web |url = http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:viwTE-kz-AUJ:rbcdaily.ru/media/562949978980393+&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=ru |title = Слово Асланяну |author = Антон Бурсак |date = 2007-10-03 |publisher = [[RBC Information Systems]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref><ref name=sitronics-expert>{{cite web |url = http://expert.ru/expert/2008/16/aslanyan/ |title = Дойные коровы Сергея Асланяна |author = Сергей Скрипников, Елена Рыцарева |date = 2008 |publisher = [[Expert (magazine)|Expert magazine]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref><ref name=sitronics-kommersant>{{cite web |url = http://www.kommersant.ru/doc/810747 |title = Вице-президент МТС стал президентом "Ситроникса" |author = Александра Ходонова |date = 2007-10-03 |publisher = [[Kommersant]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> Aslanyan presented a new strategy of the group company development, aimed at reducing non-profitable areas (e.g. consumer electronics), funding priority scientific developments of the state (e.g., microelectronics) and manufacture optimization.<ref name=bio-sf /><ref name=strategy-cnews>{{cite web |url = http://www.cnews.ru/news/top/sitroniks_pereklyuchilsya_s_chajnikov |title = "Ситроникс" переключился с чайников на нацпроекты |author = Владислав Мещеряков |date = 2008-04-09 |publisher = CNews.ru |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> From 2007 to 2012 Aslanyan was a minority shareholder of Sitronics with a share of 0.687% (up to 2010 – 0.25%). In January 2013, he left the company.<ref name=share-kommersant>{{cite web |url = http://quote.rbc.ru/news/merge/2007/12/24/31764276.html |title = Члены правления ОАО "Ситроникс" реализовали опцион на покупку 0,34% акций компании |date = 2007-12-24 |publisher = [[RBC Information Systems]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref><ref name="share-kommersant"/><ref name=share-annual>{{cite web |url = http://fs.moex.com/content/annualreports/662/1/sitronics-ar2010-rus.pdf |title = Годовой отчёт Sitronics, 2010 год // Совет директоров |date = 2007-12-24 |publisher = [[RBC Information Systems]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref>
In January 2013, together with a group of private investors Aslanyan acquired the company [[MaximaTelecom]] which was owned by the JSFC Sistema's [[systems integrator]] {{Interlanguage link multi|NVision Group|ru|3=Энвижн Груп|vertical-align=sup}} and became the head of its board of directors. In July 2013 MaximaTelecom took part in the auction of the [[Moscow Metro]] for the right of creating and operating Wi-Fi network in the subway trains and signed a contract as the only bidder. Investments in the project amounted to more than 2 billion rubles.<ref name=origins-vedomosti>{{cite web |url = http://www.vedomosti.ru/newspaper/articles/2013/07/29/sergej-aslanyan-svyazalsya-s-metro |title = Сергей Асланян связался с метро |author = Елизавета Серьгина |date = 2013-07-29 |publisher = [[Vedomosti]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-05 }}</ref> Since 1 December 2014 Free Wi-Fi was available on all subway lines.<ref name=1dec2014-rg>{{cite web |url = http://rg.ru/2014/12/05/internet.html |title = Пост из-под земли |author = Светлана Батова |date = 2014-12-05 |publisher = [[Rossiyskaya Gazeta]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-03-14 }}</ref>
== Awards and recognition == Aslanyan twice won ''IT-leader'' award in 2004 and 2006 in category ''Telecommunication companies'' and ''Mobile operators'' respectively.<ref name=leader-cnews>{{cite web |url = http://itleader.ru/laureate/2004/ |title = Список лауреатов премии «IT-лидер», 2004 год |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref><ref name=leader-it>{{cite web |url = http://www.cnews.ru/news/top/obyavleny_laureaty_premii_itlider_2006_goda |title = Объявлены лауреаты премии "IT-ЛИДЕР" 2006 года |date = 2006-04-24 |publisher = CNews.ru |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> He is a winner of ''Aristos'' award, which was established by Russian Association of Managers and the publishing house [[Kommersant]] in the category ''IT-director'' (2006).<ref name=aristos-kommersant>{{cite web |url = http://www.kommersant.ru/doc/715228 |title = Российским менеджерам досталось по заслугам |date = 2006-10-21 |publisher = [[Kommersant]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> In 2009 his name was included in the biographical reference book ''Armenian business elite of Russia'', published by scientific and educational foundation ''Erevank''.{{sfn|Дадаян|2009|с=22}} In May 2011 Aslanyan was noted among the best IT-managers of Russian Internet by the internet periodical CNews.<ref name=ed-cnews>{{cite web |url = http://biz.cnews.ru/news/top/issledovanie_cnews_gde_uchilis_luchshie |title = Исследование CNews: Где учились лучшие ИТ-менеджеры России |author = Наталья Лаврентьева |date = 2011-05-26 |publisher = CNews.ru |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> In 2011, he received the highest index of personal reputation among top managers of telecommunication companies in the ranking developed by [[Russian News Agency TASS|TASS-Telecom]].<ref name=reputation-tass>{{cite web |url = http://tass.ru/ekonomika/499693 |title = МТС и "Вымпелком" возглавили рейтинг телекоммуникационных компаний России с лучшей деловой репутацией |date = 2011-09-01 |publisher = [[Russian News Agency TASS]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref> In September 2012 the newspaper Kommersant put Aslanyan in top-10 list of the best managers in the field of information technology in the XIII annual ranking of Russian top managers.<ref name=it-kommersant>{{cite web |url = http://www.kommersant.ru/doc-y/2025247 |title = Рейтинг высших руководителей 2012 |date = 2012-09-19 |publisher = [[Kommersant]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref>
== Personal life == Sergey Aslanyan enjoys playing [[tennis]] and [[Squash (sport)|squash]].<ref name=sq-rbc>{{cite web |url = http://style.rbc.ru/news/hobby/2015/06/08/21296/ |title = Постучишь — не оторвешься: чем объяснить популярность сквоша |author = Виктор Дятликович |date = 2015-06-08 |publisher = [[RBC Information Systems]] |language = Russian |accessdate = 2016-02-12 }}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}

{{Multiple issues| {{recentism|date=December 2011}} {{refimprove|date=December 2011}} }}
'''The Queen's Award for Enterprise: Sustainable Development (Innovation Technology) (2011''') was awarded on 21 April 2011, by [[Queen Elizabeth II]].
The following organisations were awarded this year.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.queensawardsmagazine.com/winners2011 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-10-09 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114030450/http://www.queensawardsmagazine.com/winners2011 |archivedate=2012-11-14 |df= }}</ref>
== Recipients ==
*[[AGD Systems Limited]] of Staverton, Cheltenham for AGD94X series pedestrian nearside signals. *[[ARM Holdings plc]] of Cambridge for licensing of technology to partners globally for low energy chips for digital electronics. *[[J C Bamford Excavators Limited]] of Rocester, Staffordshire for lock-up torque converter fitted to backhoe loader saving fuel, emissions and travel time. *[[BBC Research & Development]] of London for the Piero sports graphics system – a tool for sports analysis on TV using 3D graphics and real-time image processing. *[[Brandon Medical Company Limited]] of Leeds, West Yorkshire for HD-LED lighting with ultra high efficiency and near perfect colour rendition across the visible spectrum. *[[Cambridge Consultants]] of Cambridge for Prism 200 - a handheld through-wall radar for counter-terrorist applications. *[[Checkmate Lifting & Safety LLP]] of Sheerness, Kent for Xcalibre fall arrest blocks to protect from falls from height. *[[Conwy Valley Systems Limited]] of Conwy for PETROG - petrographic data capture, management, analysis and reporting. *[[Datapath Limited]] of Derby for innovative video graphics and capture technology for custom and professional applications. *[[DotEcon Limited]] of London for Design and implementation of novel online auctions for radio spectrum and other uses globally. *[[DuPont Teijin Films UK Limited]] of Middlesbrough for high performance Melinex® polyester films for solar photovoltaic modules. *[[EA Technology Limited]] of Capenhurst, Cheshire for UltraTEV products assessing the condition of high and medium voltage assets in power generation, transmission and distribution. *[[ECOSYL Products Limited]] of Stokesley, North Yorkshire for ECOSYL ULV and ECOSYL 100 ultra-low volume biological inoculants for treatment and enhancement of forage for cows and sheep. *[[FFEI Limited]] of Hemel Hempstead, Hertfordshire for low cost composite resin internal drum platesetter for emerging markets. *[[Harvard Engineering PLC]] of Normanton, Wakefield for LeafNut central monitoring and wireless control system for street lighting. *[[I2 Limited|i2 Ltd]] of Fulbourn, Cambridgeshire for the Intelligence-Led Operations Platform providing transformational technology for intelligence acquisition, management, analysis / visualization and communication. *[[International Health Partners (UK) Limited]] of Wadhurst, East Sussex for innovation in new forms of donated medical aid. *[[Jagex]] of Cambridge for RuneScape, a free-to-play online Massively Multiplayer Online (MMO) game *[[Linemark (UK) Limited]] of Rawtenstall, Lancashire for the Impact Paint System used in the sports marking industry. *[[Molecular Profiles Limited]] of Nottingham for nanoPASS - an innovation for the development of pharmaceutical products. *[[The National Archives]] of Kew, Richmond for digital archiving technology and consulting software services. *[[Payne Security]] (a division of [[Filtrona C & SP Limited]]) of Giltbrook, Nottingham for a covert, highly secure authentication and government excise protection system. *[[Peak NDT Limited]] of Derby for design, development and exploitation of the Micropulse 5 series of ultrasonic NDT controllers. *[[Probrand]] of Hockley, Birmingham for innovation in buyside price comparison technology enabling best value and dynamic marketplaces. *[[Radio Design Limited]] of Shipley, West Yorkshire for the Universal Combiner Unit, allowing multiple cellular operator companies to share a common antenna system. *[[READ Well Services Limited]] of Aberdeen for Hydraulically Expandable Tubular Systems, offering flexible design solutions for drilling, completion and well integrity issues. *[[RealVNC|RealVNC Limited]] of Cambridge for innovation in VNC remote access software that allows users to connect and control one computer from another. *[[Red Bee Media|Red Bee Media Limited (Piero Division)]] of London for the Piero sports graphics system - a tool for sports analysis on TV using 3D graphics and real-time image processing. *[[Renishaw plc]] of Wotton under Edge, Gloucestershire for the TRS2 broken tool detection system. *[[Roke Manor Research Limited]] of Romsey, Hampshire for Resolve, a modular manpack electronic warfare system for the exploitation and suppression of hostile communication equipment. *[[SecurEnvoy Limited]] of Reading, Berkshire for being the inventors and vendors of tokenless [[two-factor authentication]]. *[[SELEX Galileo|Selex Galileo, Radar & Advanced Targeting]] of Edinburgh for innovation in the design and production of military lasers providing imaging, range finding and designation capabilities. *[[Sentec Limited]] of Cambridge for Sterling, an optimum platform for smart water meters, featuring solid state, durable and accurate metrology. *[[Smiths Detection|Smiths Detection Watford Limited]] of Bushey, Hertfordshire for design and manufacturer of the Lightweight Chemical Detector Series. *[[Soil Machine Dynamics Limited]] of Wallsend, Tyne and Wear for design and manufacture of work-class remotely operated vehicles (WROVs). *[[Solarcentury|Solarcentury Holdings Limited]] of London for C21e solar electric roof tiles and slates. *[[Specialised Imaging Limited]] of Tring, Hertfordshire for ultra high speed imaging systems for research, industrial, military and scientific applications. *[[Spectrum Brands (UK) Limited]] of Washington, Tyne and Wear for a mercury-free hearing aid battery and innovations to increase capacity, quality and production processes. *[[Survival Craft Inspectorate Limited]] of Findon, Aberdeen for Safelaunch, a quick-release lifeboat launch system. *[[Tessella|Tessella plc]] of Abingdon, Oxfordshire for digital archiving technology and consulting software services. *[[Trident Sensors Limited]] of Cranleigh, Surrey for innovation in the design of the Polaris GPS tracker and data communications system. *[[Vernacare Limited]] of Bolton, Lancashire for the single use washbowl made from biodegradable pulp, used to prevent healthcare acquired infections. *[[Volumatic Limited]] of Coventry for CounterCache Intelligent and the TruPouch - innovations in secure handling and management of cash by retailers. *[[Zeeko Limited]] of Coalville, Leicestershire for the Optics Fabrication Centre, an innovative ultra-precision corrective polisher range with integrated metrology.

{{Use British English|date=October 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2012}} The "'''worm'''" is a [[market research]] analysis tool developed by [[Roy Morgan Research]] (who called it "The Reactor"), with the purpose of gauging an audience's reaction to some visual stimuli over some time period. The name "worm" describes its visual appearance – as a line graph snaking up or down.
Each member of the audience firstly fills out a questionnaire, used to describe the composition of the audience. Then, each member is given a control device (such as a dial or keypad) with which they select their feelings towards the vision or stimuli (for example, whether they regard the comments currently being made by a speaker favourably or unfavourably). This dial is checked centrally three times per second, and as the audience reacts differently over time, the collective feelings of the audience are gathered.
The "worm" has been used in [[television|televised]] [[debate]]s for [[Australian federal election]]s, including those between then Australian prime minister [[John Howard]] and then-leader of the opposition [[Kevin Rudd]] in 2007<ref>{{cite news |last=Heywood |first=Lachlan |title=Worm turns against Howard |work=[[News Limited]] |publisher=news.com.au |date=21 October 2007 |url=http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,22624834-952,00.html |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071023031645/http://www.news.com.au/couriermail/story/0,23739,22624834-952,00.html |archivedate=23 October 2007 }}</ref> and between prime minister [[Julia Gillard]] and opposition leader [[Tony Abbott]] in 2010.
In the first UK general election debate on 15 April 2010 between Labour Prime Minister Gordon Brown, Conservative leader David Cameron and Liberal Democrat leader [[Nick Clegg]], "the worm" was used in certain segments.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tPlmnO9mRl8|title=The First Election Debate: Immigration – The Worm|publisher=YouTube|accessdate=10 August 2010}}</ref> A study published in March 2011 suggests that the worm may influence voters.<ref name=distortion>{{cite news | url = http://www.plosone.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0018154 | title = Social Influence in Televised Election Debates: A Potential Distortion of Democracy | first =Colin J. | last = Davis | first2 =Jeffrey S. | last2 = Bowers | first3 =Amina | last3 = Memon |date = 30 March 2011 | accessdate = 1 April 2011}}</ref>
In New Zealand, the worm has been controversially credited with increasing the support for [[United Future]] leader [[Peter Dunne]] in the 2002 election.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/news/article.cfm?c_id=3&objectid=10747425|title=Worm returns for leaders' debate|first=John|last=Drinnan|work=The New Zealand Herald|date=26 August 2011}}</ref>
